meanings.definition: Vulgates (verb): to make something widely known or popular
meanings.sent1: She vulgates her artwork by sharing it on social media.
meanings.sent2: The singer's new song quickly vulgates across the internet.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the surprise party vulgates faster than a speeding train.
meanings.sent4: His contagious laughter vulgates joy throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The colorful mural vulgates beauty to all who pass by.

meanings.definition: Vulgates (noun): the most common or popular version of a text or work
meanings.sent1: The paperback edition is the vulgates of the novel.
meanings.sent2: The vulgates of the movie script is the one used for filming.
meanings.sent3: In the library, the vulgates of the classic book is always checked out.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's notes became the vulgates for the study guide.
meanings.sent5: The traditional recipe is considered the vulgates among the family members.
